name: Royal Hotel

reviews.title: The most beautiful setting
reviews.text: Ullapool is small, so anything in this town would do, but if you stay at this hotel, make sure to get a room on the upper (first) floor facing the water. There is a room on the corner which is the best room they have. I slept very well, and the town is breathtaking. The sunsets at the end of the road where the campground is are the best. This would be an A+++ place to harbor if you sail. I love the place!

reviews.title: Good average hotel
reviews.text: I found this hotel quite hard to rate and if I could I'd put it as a 3.5. That not being an option I opted for a 3 but it's a 'good/average'.

reviews.title: Wonderful views - just average hotel!
reviews.text: The good things about this hotel:

reviews.title: Breakfast in a hurry
reviews.text: Excellent customer service from both the staff on reception and in the breakfast room. Couldn't fault this at all.

reviews.title: Perfect for Touring the West Coast
reviews.text: Clean bedroom and communal areas.

Stayed for one night before catching ferry. Large room with excellent view of Loch Broom from shared balcony. Staff could not do enough for you, especially the manager. Good evening meal (Italian menu with other options). Excellent bar. largish private car park. All in an excellent and very reasonably priced hotel and one I will definitely be using again.
reviews.title: Know how to look after customers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at The Royal, initially only booked for 2 nights, we enjoyed ourselves so much we added another, then another night!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Room was huge (family room for just the 2 of us with a double and 2 single beds), clean, comfortable, and had a great view over the loch. Breakfast and bar meals are plentiful and tasty. All the staff are friendly and helpful, and the bar service is excellent (Neil, you're a star!)
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: A perfect location for seeing the town of Ullapool and for exploring this part of the country and plenty of parking available in the hotel carpark.
reviews.title: Good, friendly service, beautiful place.

reviews.text: My husband and his motor biking friends have visited this hotel many times and continue to return, this was my first visit and would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Did not book this hotel personally part of a Rabbie,s tour but can only speak highly of service and position. Immaculate very big rooms. Breakfast was lovely and a good start to the day, not the greatest variety but very Scotish.
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Ullapool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel in fantastic surroundings with staff that could not be more friendly and accommodating. The General manager Russell is extremely helpful and always happy to point you in the right direction of things to do and see in the local area. The rooms are immaculate and extremely spacious, would highly recommend going for a loch view room as the views are incredible from the wrap around balcony. We opted to eat in the hotel bar which has a really nice feel to it, very cosy and has an extremely well stocked bar. We had a fantastic meal in very comfortable surroundings, try the venison burger you will not be disappointed. The hotel itself is very well situated to all the local amenities including the harbour. Just at the back of the hotel is a really nice walk, it is pretty step in places but it’s well worth the hike as you get wonderful views of the bay and its should give a chance to work off the top notch cooked breakfast that the you have had in the hotel that morning. Looking forward to getting back up there and having another fantastic, tranquil break!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Ullapool !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How we are treated at any venue is very important to us and from the beginning to the end of our stay at the Royal, staff were impeccable. We were given Room 6, which was large, clean with all of the facilities you would expect from a good Hotel. We also had a door out on to the wrap around balcony with comfortable seating outside and beautiful views. Ullapool was a really pleasant surprise a lovely picturesque location. The best nights sleep all holiday the bed was so very comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: We chose to eat in the Bar in the Evening rather than the restaurant, for no particular reason other than we fancied a Bar meal rather than a 2 or 3 course meal. However, our order was still taken at the table by a very polite and efficient young man and the food was of good quality and enjoyable, very relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was in the restaurant and we had a table in the window which once again allowed us to enjoy the very pretty views. Breakfast was lovely and the staff attentive and friendly. Check out was efficient and we were waved on our way and wished a safe journey.
reviews.title: Good food and facilities - at reasonable prices

reviews.text: The hotel is situated at the foot of Wawel Castle and is within close proximity to the main market square (a short stroll up Grodzka) and the Jewish district of Kazimierz - an ideal location for us.
reviews.title: great hotel + location

reviews.text: The interior of the Hotel was very grand around the main reception and stairs - the fixtures and fittings very art nouveau in style, I would agree with another review that stated it has 'an air of faded elegance' this was true of the rooms, they were however, clean and more than adequate for our stay. There was a TV and fridge in the room but no tea/coffee making facilities so take a travel kettle if required. Room service is provided daily.
reviews.title: execllent location, great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night and we had an apartment. There are only two and we had app.#105 thinking it should be better than an ordinary room. We arrived late so couldnt go looking for another hotel. In the morning we moved to hotel Metropol which is supposed to be 4 star but I can hardly give it two stars for what it offers.
reviews.title: terrible is not the word
go for it
reviews.text: Anyway if you can stay away from this hotel.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, good facilities, great value for money, but cold service
reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I would rate this hotel highly for its facilities and value for money. The room I stayed in was large, with a great view over the Loch. A few reviews have said that the hotel and its facilities are slightly dated, but everything works and nothing seems worn out. Free wifi and plenty of complementary drinks in the room all help make the hotel a very acceptable place to stay. The evening meal in the restaurant was also very good, although breakfast less so.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous in Ullapool
reviews.text: What stops the hotel getting 5 stars (in my opinion) is the lack of warmth from the staff. Unlike with a previous reviewer, no one was rude, but the staff I interacted with just didn't seem very "people friendly", which for customer facing staff is surprising. This was highlighted (but not isolated to) when the evening meal was delivered without a single word being uttered and then the same again when the plate was taken away. In 30 years of eating in restaurants around the world, that is a true first.

reviews.title: Tour Group Hotel With little Charm
reviews.text: So if you hope to stay in a hotel where you can bask in the warmth of people who make you feel as if they genuinely want you to be there, then look elsewhere. However, if you can accept the slight downside of the clinical interaction, then the hotel itself, great rooms, good food and excellent value for money more than makes up for the slightly brusk way you might find yourself being treated.

reviews.title: Hotel with the best view of Loch Broom
reviews.text: This was my fourth visit to this hotel. I travelled with 10 of my buddies on motorbikes and we had great fun. There was a wedding on during our stay as well as some folks taking advantage of the hill walking and another group touring the highlands in sportscars. The Hotels got a great view out over loch Broom and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. nothing was a problem for them. The hotels got free wifi which we put to good use and was fantastic value for money. Down town Ulapool if you can call it that is but plesant five minute walk, and if you fancy a stroll to walk off dinner theres a 2KM trek up the hill behind the hotel that gives stunning views over loch broom. The hotel does a dinner bed and breakfast rate that is good value and the food was excellent. Ulapool itself is a fantastic location to base a tour of the highlands, with applecross, Durness and Torridon easy reach in a day by car or bike. overall I'm very happy with this place and my friends and I will be back.

reviews.title: Royal by name only!
reviews.text: We booked three nights based on ratings from Trip Advisor and photos. Not a bad place, but I didn't travel that far to have a clean efficient big hotel as my home. The Royal caters to lots of senioe citizens on big bus tours. When a lot of people use a place they skew the survey results. McDonalds and Pizza Hut constantly rate as the bet burgers and pizzas. I was hoping for something more initmate and with local flavor. The photographer would be my choice for my internet dating picture. The place is OK, but the photes are just beautiful. the Royal is just average..

Stayed in the Royal last month during a weekend stag do visit and was pleasantly surprised. We had three rooms between us, which were all tidy and clean. Our room was massive, which was nice. Breakfast was pretty nice too, the one morning we made it there. Anyway, if you're travelling on a budget, the Royal should suit you down to the ground.
reviews.title: Krakow heaven
Only thing missin was the elevator!
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, fab breakfasts, great location, basic clean room! We were in a cheap room on the top floor & the lift was out for out stay....not ideal especially after a night out on the brill Pivo!!! Would recommend payin a bit more & gettin a nicer room!!
Stayed here whilst on my Stag weekend and I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. We had three rooms but in total we had13 beds. The rooms were massive. They even had a table and chairs in them.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Location is spot on. It's right next to teh castle and 5 minutes walk to the main square.
reviews.title: In City Centre Budget Hotel
Excellent Value for Money
reviews.text: We didn't eat there so can' t comment about the food but there are loads of restaurants nearby.

description: One of the premier luxury hotels in the Scottish Highlands, the Royal will delight the most discerning of guests and offers 55 en-suite rooms, many with breathtaking views over Loch Broom and the others over rugged mountain landscapes. The privately owned Royal Hotel is a matchless and precious jewel of the Highlands, uniquely situated to offer the perfect combination of comfort and a stunning seaside loch location with a minute walk to the town centre.
